newsitem.title: MEXICO: Sigma says earmarks $17 mln cheese plant.
newsitem.headline: Sigma says earmarks $17 mln cheese plant.

text.p: Food company Sigma Alimentos, a subsidiary of the industrial conglomerate Alfa, will invest $17 million in the western Mexican state of Jalisco, the company's director of administration said.
The project is still on the drawing board, but investment is expected to begin in the fourth quarter of 1996, said director Luis Gerardo Villarreal in a telephone interview.

The aim of building the cheese plant is to raise Sigma's share of the domestic market from one to six percent. Sigma chose the location, next to an existing yoghurt plant owned by the company, for being in a major dairy producing area, he added. The company already owns the site.
Villarreal said that construction costs will be met out of cash flow, while bank loans were being considered to finance the acquisition of Machinery.
